intro: Gesnera, commonly known as the "gardeners' glory," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Gesneriaceae. These plants are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. Gesnera species are typically shrubs or small trees with showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value, featuring vibrant foliage and long-lasting blooms. Many species are popular in horticulture due to their adaptability and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
